clinical_study.brief_title: Genetical Background of Non-alcoholic Fatty Liver Disease (NAFLD) in Diabetes Mellitus and in Chronic Kidney Disease
clinical_study.official_title: Genetical Background of Non-alcoholic Fatty Liver Disease (NAFLD) in Diabetes Mellitus and in Chronic Kidney Disease

brief_summary.textblock: The present study investigates relationship between non-alcoholic fatty liver disease and its risk factors, such as genetic background and diseases, such as chronic kidney disease and diabetes mellitus.

detailed_description.textblock:
Non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) is a multisystemic disease, also affecting extrahepatic organs (1,2,6). According to former data, not only the prevalence of chronic hepatic disease, chronic cardiovascular diseases, but also the prevalence of chronic kidney disease (CKD) is higher in NAFLD (4,7). A strong association has been shown between diabetes mellitus (DM) and NAFLD as well (3,5,10).
Many genetical factors have been studied in the background of NAFLD. Many studies have proved the effect of patatin-like phospholipase domain-containing protein 3 gene (PNPLA3) (8,9). Effect of numerous genetical polymorphisms has been suggested behind oxidative stress responsible for NAFLD (8).

primary_outcome.measure: Association of NFS (NAFLD fibrosis score) and HSI (hepatic steatosis index) with underlying conditions
primary_outcome.description: The association of hepatic steatosis with chronic kidney disease, diabetes mellitus and the the persence of these two will be assessed

primary_outcome.measure: Association of genetical factors with NFS and HSI
primary_outcome.description: The association of hepatic steatosis with genetic factors will be assessed. In case of patatin-like phospholipase domain-containing protein 3 gene (PNPLA3) : rs738409, rs2281135, rs2294918 single nuclear polimorfism (SNP) will be examined

secondary_outcome.measure: Association of hepatic steatosis with renal function
secondary_outcome.description: The association of serum creatinine, eGFR, blood urea nitrogen, serum sodium, serum potassium, serum calcium with NFS and HSI will be assessed

secondary_outcome.measure: Association of glucose metabolism parameters with hepaic steatosis indices
secondary_outcome.description: Association of HbA1C, fructosamine, blood glucose, serum insulin, HOMAIR, serum uric acid with NFS and HSI

secondary_outcome.measure: Association of liver function and hepatic setatosis indices
secondary_outcome.description: Association of serum bilirubine, serum GOT, serum GPT, serum GGT, serum ALP, serum LDH, INR, serum total protein, serum albumin with NFS and HSI

secondary_outcome.measure: Association of serum lipid profile and hepatic setatosis indices
secondary_outcome.description: Association of serum total cholesterol, serum HDL-cholesterol, serum LDL-cholesterol, serum triglyceride, serum carnitine with NFS and HSI

secondary_outcome.measure: Association of iron metabolism parameters with hepatic setatosis indices
secondary_outcome.description: association of serum iron, serum transferrine, serum transferrine saturation, serum ferritine with NFS and HSI

secondary_outcome.measure: The relationship between blood count, sedimentation and inflammation with hepatic setatosis indices
secondary_outcome.description: Association of blood count, erythrocyte sedimentation rate, CRP with NFS and HSI

secondary_outcome.measure: Assotion of serum proteins with hepatic setatosis indices
secondary_outcome.description: association of urinary total protein, urinary albumin, urinary total protein/creatinine ratio, urinary albumin/creatinine ratio with NFS and HSI

secondary_outcome.measure: Association of pathological tyrosine isoforms with hepatic setatosis indices
secondary_outcome.description: Association of serum meta-Tyr, serum ortho-Tyr, urinary meta-Tyr, urinary ortho-Tyr, urinary meta-Tyr/creatinine ratio, urinary ortho-Tyr/creatinine ratio with NFS and HSI

study_pop.textblock: Patients with CKD without DM, or patients with DM without CKD, or patients with both CKD and DM, aged 18-90

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- CKD (renal replacement therapy non excluded)
- DM
- CKD+DM
Exclusion Criteria:
- alcohol abuse
